title: 1972 CONCACAF Pre-Olympic Tournament
text:
The 1972 CONCACAF Pre-Olympic Tournament was the third edition of the <a href="CONCACAF%20Men%27s%20Olympic%20Qualifying%20Championship">CONCACAF Pre-Olympic Tournament</a>, the quadrennial, international <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament organised by the <a href="CONCACAF">CONCACAF</a> to determine which national teams from the North, Central America and Caribbean region qualify for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%20Summer%20Olympics">Olympic football tournament</a>.
<a href="Mexico%20Olympic%20football%20team">Mexico</a>, won their second title, and qualified for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201972%20Summer%20Olympics">1972 Summer Olympics</a> together with runners-up <a href="United%20States%20men%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States</a> as CONCACAF representatives.
Qualification.
Qualified teams.
The following teams qualified for the final tournament.
Qualified teams for Summer Olympics.
The following two teams from CONCACAF qualified for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201972%20Summer%20Olympics">1972 Summer Olympics</a>, including Mexico which qualified as hosts.
